posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>53226072
Golurk deserves so much better. It's clearly built to be a strong, slow physical attacker but they gave it no bulk and it has no real tools to do what it needs to do. Yes, it can spam moves like Dynamic Punch with No Guard and it had access to Poltergeist in Gen 8. But is that really the best it can achieve? Seriously?

>Swap out Klutz for Weak Armor when it evolves. Now it can get +2 Speed boosts off weak hits or switching into a resisted hit.
>Shadow Punch is clearly meant to be its bread and butter (alongside other punches). Buff that move's BP to 75 so it can match the other elemental punches. With STAB and Iron Fist it now hits closer to Poltergeist in power but more importantly has perfect accuracy no matter what.
>Give it access to more moves so it has better coverage it can use. It has access to a lot of fun moves but it can't really use a lot of them.
>Physical Moves to Add: Meteor Mash, Headlong Rush (which is a punching move apparently), Wring Out, Retaliate, Stomp (it doesn't learn this??)
>Special: Zap Cannon, Twin Beam, Psybeam, Mystical Fire, Meteor Beam
>Utility: Wide Guard, Quash, Power Split, Guard Split, Autotomize, Rapid Spin, Lock-On, Focus Energy
>Change stats accordingly to make it a little bulkier and a little more offensive just to deal with power creep. New stats below:
>HP 105 (+16)
>ATT 134 (+10)
>DEF 85 (+5)
>SPA 60 (+5)
>SPD 85 (+5)
>SPE 55 (+0)
>BST 524 (+41)

By doing this Golurk now has a bit more staying power and can hit a lot harder with some new options at its disposal. You can also pull off interesting combos now with No Guard Zap Cannon + Meteor Beam, or Iron Fist Meteor Mash + Headlong Rush + Buffed Shadow Punch. And with Weak Armor, you could build a support set that runs moves like Stealth Rock, Rapid Spin, Wide Guard... It would have way more utility and start to feel like the "big friendly strong robot" vibe I think they were actually going for with its design.

Its certainly not a different hack entirely or anything. But it is an improvement on what was already pretty solid.

if you want a new region and don't care about fakemon, play clover/vega (vega is extremely difficult; play vega minus/viva las vega if you want a better experience)
otherwise yeah, the two you've played are the best
tl;dr: none really compare to those two

Here's my take on types:

Bug-type
- Bug no longer resists Fighting.
- Bug now resists Psychic.

Electric-type
- Electric is now weak to Ghost.

Fairy-type
- Fairy no longer resists Bug.
- Fairy is now weak to Grass and Psychic.

Fighting
- Fighting no longer resists Bug.

Ghost-type
- Ghost no longer resists Bug.
- Ghost now resists Electric.

Grass-type
- Grass is now immune to Fairy.

Ground-type
- Ground is no longer weak to Water.
- Ground is now weak to Steel.

Ice-type
- Ice now resists Ground and Flying

Psychic-type
- Psychic now resists Fairy.

Water-type
- Water is now weak to Poison.

Rock-type
- Rock is no longer weak to Grass.

Steel-type
- Steel is now weak to Electric.
- Steel is no longer immune to Poison, it just resists it, but it remains immune to Poison status.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>53213910
>>53213929
The Pokemon id is internally a 16-bit number so you could have 65535 Pokemon, but you would run out of ROM space with sprites and cries way before that. Same with moves. Abilities are limited to 256.

Since you have the source code for the game, you could change the data types used to increase the limits, making ROM space the only hard limit.

>>53231089
>is it really a cat?
Yes. They are based on nekomata, a type of demon cats with two tails that split from the tip of the original. Also- their feminine alien look and shiny version could be referencing "Midori no Neko", a jade-colored cat with an otherwordly green glow (guess the twist). But their red jewel could mean Espeon were inspired by a creature from Final Fantasy called Carbuncle, which has a similar gem that uses Ruby Light to cast Reflect- a spell that makes MAGIC BOUNCE back to the enemy.
>other Eevee-lutions look like dogs.
Umbreon is a cat too but with bunny ears, which signify their relationship to the night and the moon.
>I'm pretty sure Eevee's a dog.
Eevee were admittedly based on a "fox-squirrel" from "Nausicaä of the Valley of the Wind", which in turn were inspired by fennec foxes.

>Also, the green light is symbolic of the ways that money and affluence ruin the lives of those without and the way that the American dream ruins the lives of those eternally reaching for it.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
The fabled pokedex that somehow managed to be worse than 8’s. Taught me to never believe in the bottom of the barrel because there’s always a floor beneath it waiting to be broken.
3 whole evolution lines that don’t change in any significant way on evolution and try to excuse it with a gimmick (Palafin, Pawmi, Maushold).
An influx of retarded bullshit meant to pass off old designs as new (convergent, paradox, “breeds” of regionals).
Only 5 fucking families that end on anything other than a sour note (Tink because tinkatink set the bar so fucking low, Hound see aforementioned, Armor see aforementioned, Glim, Espath).
Hackneyed, clearly-rushed, lazy bullshit for the rest of it.
I struggle to find designs I can even call decent. This is the first generation ever to not immediately introduce at least one candidate for top 20 of all time. Even Alola had Litten and the faceless, wiggly UB trio (Xurkitree, Nihilego, Blacephalon). Even Galar had fucking Corviknight before the DLC.
Paldea has nothing, and yet has managed to add plenty to my least-favorite-of-all-time without even trying (Goldhengo, Quaquaval, Palafin, Knigambit, Dondozo, Rellor, Chien-Pao, Baxcalibur, I can go on).

It’s not a fun feeling bros. I just want even one good design. But all of my favorites from this gen either come from existing families (Dudun, Farigiraf, Clod) or literally ARE those families with extra doo-dads (Slither, Great T). I guess there’s Miraidon and Glimmora, maybe, but I like neither of them nearly as much as I liked my favorites in gen 7 or previous and not as much as Corviknight.
I don’t even want to call this thing lazy, I just don’t know what else to say about it. It’s shit? Yeah, of course it is, but how? Well… like that, I guess.

>>53233470
Pretty much this. As much as you want them to due to autism/knowing that landmasses are shaped the way they are due to tectonic plates and geological activity over millions of years, it probably is still one of these scenarios now where it's different. This is why whenever they show the world of Pokémon (XY Ultimate Weapon cutscene, globes in the recent anime, maps) it's intentionally low quality or vague.
I'm certainly not a fan of shoehorning in mountains and deserts for every region (Unova and Reversal Mountain, Kalos and the desert, ALOLA and the desert) they do it because the geologic differences allow them to give you more Pokémon environments.
The best region that did this in a logical yet fun manner was Hoenn, I mean you still have an abandoned Power Plant, an artificial reef, the seafloor, an actual volcano, the only routes that felt a little underwhelming or entirely not unique probably would be the land routes after Fortree + some of the water routes that didn't do anything unique unlike the Region puzzle water current routes. It is kind of hard to come up with more unique water routes however.
Alola was also good but it did suffer from those nonsensical biomes the most.
